Package com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.niox

Class Product

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.niox.Product
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Component, Kit
    public abstract class Product
extends java.lang.Object
    Product is an abstract class with a part-number, description, and price.
    Author:
    Arthur Vargas

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(java.lang.String d)
        Sets the description to the pararmeter string. If the string is null or empty an IllegalArgumentExcpetion is thrown
        Parameters:
        description - the description to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the string provided for the description is null or empty.

      • setPartNumber

        public void setPartNumber​(java.lang.String pn)
        Sets the part-number for this product to the value of pn. If the pn parameter is null or does not begin with a number then setPartNumber throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        pn - the part-number for this product.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pn parameter is null

      • getPartNumber

        public java.lang.String getPartNumber()
        Returns the part-number for this product.
        Returns:
        partNumber the part-number for the product

      • setPrice

        public void setPrice​(double p)
        Sets the price for this product to the value passed in by 'p'.
        Parameters:
        p - the price for the product.

      • getPrice

        public java.lang.Double getPrice()
        Returns the price
        Parameters:
        p - the price for the product.

      • setPrice

        public void setPrice​(java.lang.String p)
        Sets the price for this product to the value passed in by 'p'. If there is a problem parsing the value or if the parsed value is less than 0, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        p - the price for the product.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the 'p' parameter is invalid

      • getShortDisplayArray
